member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand
member.summary: Defines a command that can be exposed and triggered for a domain via the json configurator.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.ID
member.summary: A unique identifier for the command. Can be used to reference the command in status dashboards.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name to use for the command. Optional.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.HelpText
member.summary: Help text to expose for the command. Optional.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.ExtensionMethod
member.summary: The extension method to call when the command is triggered.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.Locations
member.summary: A list of locations specifying where and how the command will be shown.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.ConfirmMessage
member.summary: If specified, the message will be displayed to the user in a confirmation dialog after they've triggered the command, but before its execution. They will have the option to proceed or cancel the command.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.Blocking
member.summary: Indicates whether the interface should be blocked while the command is being executed. Useful for longer running commands where further user interaction with the interface could negatively effect user experience or execution, or simply a way to indicate to the user that something is happening, and when it is over.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Interfaces.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.ExposeErrors
member.summary: Indicates whether errors should be exposed to the caller in JavaScript. - When true, any errors are not handled by the default handler... Instead they are allowed to bubble up through the promise chain. This allows them to be handled by non-default implementations. - When false, the default handler is used. This will show the message in a MFClientScript.IDashboard.ShowMessage() dialog.

member.summary: Containers in which s can be displayed.
